newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore residue stocks down, distillates up.
newsitem.headline: Singapore residue stocks down, distillates up.

text.p: Singapore weekly residues stocks fell by 509,000 barrels, to 9.922 million barrels for the week ending May 7, Singapore's Trade Development Board (TDB) statistics showed on Thursday.
They include HSFO, LSFO, LSWR and the straight-run atmospheric residue, but exclude bitumen.
Middle-distillate stocks rose by 1.013 million barrels to 8.798 million barrels.
Middle distillates comprise jet, kerosene and gas oil.
Light distillates stocks rose by 291,000 barrels to 7.557 million barrels.
Light distillate comprise gasoline, reformate and naphtha.
